Product or Service Description: R&D- ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION: WATER POLLUTION (BASIC RESEARCH)
Description of Requirement:
IGF::CL::IGF

THIS PROJECT WILL INVESTIGATE THE EXTENDED PERFORMANCE OF GREEN ROOFS IN AN URBAN ENVIRONMENT TO REDUCE THE EFFECTS OF RAINFALL INDUCED POLLUTION THROUGH HYDROLOGIC MEASUREMENTS. QUANTIFYING AND MODELING LONG TERM HYDROLOGIC PERFORMANCE WILL IMPROVE URBAN WATERSHED MANAGEMENT AND WILL ASSIST IN THE FURTHER ADOPTION OF THIS GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE TECHNIQUE.
Vendor Name: TRUSTEES OF COLUMBIA UNIVERSITY IN THE CITY OF NEW YORK, THE

Product or Service Description: R&D- ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION: WATER POLLUTION (BASIC RESEARCH)
Description of Requirement:
IGF::OT::IGF THIS PROJECT WILL STUDY GI AS A WAY TO REDUCE STORMWATER RUNOFF AND IMPROVE WATER QUALITY IN URBAN AREAS OF PUERTO RICO. AT ITS CORE, GI SEEKS TO CAPTURE AND TREAT STORMWATER AT ITS SOURCE (A PRINCIPLE OF LID - LOW IMPACT DEVELOPMENT) THROUGH THE USE OF GREEN PRACTICES (E.G., BIORETENTION AND RAIN GARDENS, GRASSED SWALES AND FILTER STRIPS) AS OPPOSED TO TRADITIONAL GREY INFRASTRUCTURE AS EXEMPLIFIED BY THE USE OF CURB AND GUTTERS DELIVERING RUNOFF TO STORMWATER CONVEYANCE FOR RAPID DISCHARGE TO RECEIVING WATERS. PUERTO RICO HAS NUMEROUS WATER QUALITY PROBLEMS AS THERE ARE MANY COMMUNITIES THROUGHOUT THE ISLAND THAT HAVE INADEQUATE STORM SEWER SYSTEMS WHICH CAUSES FLOODING AS WELL AS SURCHARGING OF SANITARY SEWERS, LEADING TO SANITARY SEWER OVERFLOWS (SSO). THIS RESEARCH AND DEMONSTRATION IS ALSO NEEDED AS THE CLIMATE OF PUERTO RICO MAY BRING UNFORESEEN CHALLENGES TO GI DESIGN AS THERE ARE LARGE PRECIPITATION EVENTS AND WARM WATERS YEAR ROUND. 

THE OVERALL OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO DESIGN, CONSTRUCT, MONITOR AND EVALUATE, INCLUDING MAINTENANCE PRACTICES, A GI PRACTICE IN AN URBAN PART OF PUERTO RICO, SO THAT THIS TECHNOLOGY CAN BE SUCCESSFULLY ADOPTED ELSEWHERE ON THE ISLAND.

Product or Service Description: R&D- ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION: WATER POLLUTION (APPLIED RESEARCH/EXPLORATORY DEVELOPMENT)
Description of Requirement:
IGF::CT::IGF

UNITED STATES ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY
OFFICE OF RESEARCH&DEVELOPMENT/NHEERL/EPHD

PROFESSIONAL SERVICES CONTRACT  
SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA COASTAL WATER RESEARCH PROJECT (SCCWRP)

DATABASE OF WATER QUALITY MONITORING FROM BEACH MONITORING STUDIES










1) DEVELOP DATABASE IN MS EXCEL WITH SAMPLE RESULTS FOR COLIPHAGE AND OTHER FECAL INDICATOR ORGANISMS ((1,000 - 5,000 RECORDS)
2) DATABASE IN MS EXCEL WITH ANY ANCILLARY DATA COLLECTED (1,000 - 5,000 RECORDS)
3) CODEBOOK DESCRIBING THE VARIABLE NAMES WITH REFERENCES FOR THE METHODS USED (3 - 5 PAGES)
4) REPORT DESCRIBING THE RESULTS OF THE COLIPHAGE TESTS AND HIGHLIGHTING ANY ISSUES WITH THE DATA (3 PAGES)

REQUIREMENT:

ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (EPA) REQUIRE A DATABASE OF WATER QUALITY MONITORING COLLECTED BY THE SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA COASTAL WATER RESEARCH PROJECT (SCCWRP) FROM SEVERAL BEACH MONITORING STUDIES. DATA INCLUDE INDIVIDUAL SAMPLE RESULTS FOR ANY TESTS AND COLIPHAGE AND FECAL INDICATOR ORGANISMS FROM EPIDEMIOLOGICAL FIELD STUDIES CONDUCTED BETWEEN 2003 AND 2012. SITES INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO; MISSION BAY, AVALON, MALIBU CALIFORNIA. DATABASE SHALL INCLUDE SAMPLE RESULTS ALONG WITH A CODEBOOK INDICATING REFERENCE FOR METHOD USED AS WELL AS ANY ANCILLARY DATA COLLECTED (WATER TEMPERATURE, TURBIDITY, ETC.). IN ADDITION TO THE DATABASE, A BRIEF REPORT WILL ALSO BE PROVIDED SUMMARIZING THE COLIPHAGE RESULTS FOR VARIOUS METHODS AND THE QUALITY ASSURANCE PLAN FOR THE DATA.
Vendor Name: SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA COASTAL WATER RESEARCH PROJECT AUTHORITY

CONTRACT TITLE: CLEAN AIR STATUS AND TRENDS NETWORK (CASTNET)
THE PURPOSE OF THIS TASK ORDER IS TO IMPROVE THE SCIENCE AND UNDERSTANDING OF DEPOSITION PROCESS WITHIN THE ATMOSPHERE. THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (EPA) IS CURRENTLY EVALUATING THE SECONDARY NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARD (NAAQS) FOR NOX AND SOX. THE WORK UNDER THIS TASK WILL ENHANCE THE EXISTING RESEARCH CURRENTLY AVAILABLE ON DIRECT DEPOSITION METHODS, ATMOSPHERIC CHEMICAL PROCESSES THAT DRIVE DEPOSITION PARAMETERS AND ESTIMATES OF SULFUR AND NITROGEN LOADING TO VARIOUS LANDSCAPES.

THIS IS A PURCHASE ORDER AWARD FOR ANALYSIS SERVICES TO DETERMINE THE ECOLOGICAL EFFECTS OF CHEMICAL FLAME RETARDANTS (FRS), SPECIFICALLY INCLUDING THE ANALYTE 2-ETHYLHEXYL 2,3,4,5-TETRABROMOPHTHALATE (TBPH) IN MEDIA (SUCH AS FOOD AND SEDIMENT) AND BIOLOGICAL SAMPLES (FISH AND WORM TISSUES). THIS PURCHASE ORDER WILL REQUIRE THE VENDOR TO ANALYZE A MINIMUM OF 100 AND A MAXIMUM OF 200 SAMPLES OF MEDIA AND BIOLOGICAL TISSUES (~1 G).  THE EPA WILL PROVIDE THE CONTRACTOR WITH THESE SAMPLES. THIS IS AN IDIQ PURCHASE ORDER AWARD WITH A FIRM-FIXED PRICE CLIN FOR THE MINIMUM ORDER OF 100 SAMPLES AT A TOTAL OF $40,000.00 PLUS A FIXED UNIT PRICE CLIN FOR EACH ADDITIONAL SAMPLE ORDERED BY EPA, UP TO 100 SAMPLES AT $400/SAMPLE. THE TOTAL POTENTIAL MAXIMUM PRICE FOR THE ENTIRE PURCHASE ORDER, INCLUDING BOTH CLINS, IS $80,000.00. THE CONTRACTOR'S TECHNICAL AND PRICE PROPOSAL DATED AUGUST 13, 2015 , THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS, AND STATEMENT OF WORK ARE ATTACHED. THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE IS FROM 10/1/2015 THROUGH 9/30/2017.

IGF::OT::IGF - INTEGRATED RISK INFORMATION SYSTEM (IRIS) PROGRAM 
THE PURPOSE OF THIS TASK ORDER IS TO PROVIDE SERVICES TO THE U.S. ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY'S (EPA) OFFICE OF RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT (ORD), NATIONAL CENTER FOR ENVIRONMENTAL ASSESSMENT (NCEA), IN THE DERIVATION OF PROVISIONAL TOXICITY VALUES (PTVS) AND PREPARATION OF ASSOCIATED PTV DOCUMENTS.

Fair Opportunity/Limited Sources: FOLLOW-ON ACTION FOLLOWING COMPETITIVE INITIAL ACTION
Description of Requirement: IGF::OT::IGF - THE PURPOSE OF THIS TASK ORDER IS TO PROVIDE SERVICES TO ASSIST THE U.S. ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCYS (EPA) NATIONAL CENTER FOR ENVIRONMENTAL ASSESSMENT (NCEA), OFFICE OF RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT (ORD), IN DEVELOPING COMPUTATIONAL MODELS TO ESTIMATE DISPOSITION OF SELECT METALS IN SUPPORT OF INTEGRATED RISK INFORMATION SYSTEM (IRIS) TOXICOLOGICAL REVIEWS AND RELATED MATERIALS.

Fair Opportunity/Limited Sources: FOLLOW-ON ACTION FOLLOWING COMPETITIVE INITIAL ACTION
Description of Requirement:
IGF::OT::IGF - PRODUCTION SUPPORT FOR DEVELOPING IRIS ASSESSMENTS
THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS TASK ORDER IS TO OBTAIN PRODUCTION SUPPORT (EDITING AND/OR WORD PROCESSING) FOR SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL PRODUCTS THAT ARE PRODUCED DURING THE DEVELOPMENT OF AN IRIS ASSESSMENT.  THESE MAY INCLUDE TOXICOLOGICAL REVIEWS, IRIS SUMMARIES, LITERATURE SEARCH DOCUMENTATION, EVIDENCE TABLES, EXPOSURE-RESPONSE ARRAYS, FACT SHEETS, AND OTHER COMMUNICATION MATERIALS

Fair Opportunity/Limited Sources: FOLLOW-ON ACTION FOLLOWING COMPETITIVE INITIAL ACTION
Description of Requirement:
IGF::OT::IGF - GENERAL SUPPORT OF THE DEVELOPMENT OF INTEGRATED RISK INFORMATION SYSTEM (IRIS) TOXICOLOGICAL REVIEWS 

THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS TASK ORDER IS TO ASSIST THE IRIS DIVISION IN DEVELOPING TOXICOLOGICAL REVIEWS AND RELATED MATERIALS.  THE PRIMARY TASKS UNDER THIS OBJECTIVE INCLUDE THE DEVELOPMENT OF:

1) SCOPING AND PROBLEM FORMULATION SUMMARIES;2) EVIDENCE TABLES OF ORGAN-SPECIFIC AND OTHER SUMMARY TABLES OF HEALTH EFFECTS INFORMATION; 3) EXPOSURE-RESPONSE ARRAYS OF ORGAN-SPECIFIC TOXICITY;
4) SUMMARY TABLE OF HAZARD IDENTIFICATION AND/OR DOSE-RESPONSE CONCLUSIONS FROM OTHER GOVERNMENTAL OR INTERNATIONAL HEALTH ASSESSMENT ORGANIZATION; 5) EVALUATION AND SYNTHESIS OF THE EVIDENCE FOR INDIVIDUAL HEALTH EFFECTS AND RELATED INFORMATION; AND 6) DEVELOPMENT AND EVALUATION OF SYSTEMATIC REVIEW APPROACHES AS APPLIED TO IRIS ASSESSMENTS.

Fair Opportunity/Limited Sources: FOLLOW-ON ACTION FOLLOWING COMPETITIVE INITIAL ACTION
Description of Requirement: IGF::OT::IGF - THE PURPOSE OF THIS TASK IS TO PROVIDE SERVICES TO THE U.S. ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCYS (EPA) NATIONAL CENTER FOR ENVIRONMENTAL ASSESSMENT (NCEA), OFFICE OF RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT (ORD), IN DEVELOPING A RELATIVE POTENCY FACTOR (RPF) APPROACH FOR POLYCYCLIC AROMATIC HYDROCARBON (PAH) MIXTURES AS ONE APPROACH TO ASSESSING CANCER RISK FROM EXPOSURE TO PAH MIXTURES

Fair Opportunity/Limited Sources: FOLLOW-ON ACTION FOLLOWING COMPETITIVE INITIAL ACTION
Description of Requirement: IGF::OT::IGF - THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS TASK ORDER IS TO ASSIST THE IRIS DIVISION IN DEVELOPING IRIS HEALTH ASSESSMENTS BY IDENTIFYING THE RELEVANT HEALTH EFFECTS LITERATURE AND DOCUMENTING LITERATURE SEARCH STRATEGIES AND OUTCOMES OF THE LITERATURE SEARCH. THE CHEMICAL ASSESSMENTS THAT WILL REQUIRE LITERATURE SEARCH AND DOCUMENTATION UNDER THIS PWS WILL BE IDENTIFIED THROUGH TECHNICAL DIRECTION (TD).  THE TD WILL SPECIFY THE CHEMICAL, NATURE OF THE SEARCH AND DOCUMENTATION REQUESTED, AND THE SCHEDULE FOR COMPLETING THE WORK.

Product or Service Description: ENVIRONMENTAL SYSTEMS PROTECTION- WATER QUALITY SUPPORT
Description of Requirement: IGF::OT::IGF NONPOINT SOURCE MONITORING. THE GOAL OF THIS TASK ORDER IS TO PROVIDE EPA, STATES AND LOCALS WITH TECHNICAL AND TECHNOLOGY TRANSFER ASSISTANCE REGARDING SELECT NONPOINT SOURCE PROJECTS AND TOPICS.  TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE FOR PROJECTS CAN INCLUDE REVIEW OF PROPOSED IMPLEMENTATION PLANS AND MONITORING PLANS; ASSISTANCE WITH THE DESIGN OF MONITORING EFFORTS; AND ASSISTANCE WITH EVALUATING WATER QUALITY AND LAND TREATMENT/USE DATA.  ASSISTANCE WILL ALSO BE GIVEN FOR ANALYSIS/ESTABLISHMENT OF WATER QUALITY AND LAND TREATMENT DATA OF INDIVIDUAL PROJECTS.  STATE PROJECT PERSONNEL WILL PROVIDE ALL WATER QUALITY/LAND TREATMENT DATA AND INFORMATION.  THE CONTRACTOR SHALL PROVIDE A BRIEF SUMMARY OF THE ANALYSES COMPLETED FOR EACH PROJECT

Description of Requirement:
IGF::OT::IGF: OFFSHORE MARINE DEBRIS SEARCH SUPPORT SERVICES  
THE PURPOSE OF THE OFFSHORE MARINE DEBRIS SEARCH (OMDS) CONTRACT IS TO PROVIDE NATIONALLY CONSISTENT TECHNICAL SUPPORT SERVICES TO ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (EPA) ON-SCENE COORDINATORS (OSCS), REGIONAL RESPONSE TEAMS (RRTS), REMEDIAL PROJECT MANAGERS (RPMS) AND OTHER FEDERAL OFFICIALS IN IMPLEMENTING THE EPA S RESPONSIBILITIES PURSUANT TO THE NATIONAL RESPONSE SYSTEM. THESE RESPONSIBILITIES ARE DESCRIBED IN THE BACKGROUND BELOW. THE CONTRACTOR SHALL ASSIST IN FULFILLING THESE RESPONSIBILITIES WITHIN THE REGION AND POTENTIALLY OUTSIDE THE REGION THROUGH BACKUP REGIONAL RESPONSE, CROSS REGIONAL RESPONSE, NATIONAL RESPONSE, AND INTERNATIONAL RESPONSE. THE CONTRACTOR SHALL BE PREPARED TO PROVIDE SCIENTIFIC/TECHNICAL SUPPORT FOR EPA ACTIVITIES IN FURTHERANCE OF THE AGENCY S PRIMARY MISSION: THE PROTECTION OF HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT. 
EPA S ROLE IN OFFSHORE MARINE DEBRIS OCCURRENCE SITES WOULD BE TO SUPPORT MEMBERS OF THE OCEANIA AND REGION 9 REGIONAL RESPONSE TEAMS (E.G., DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR US FISH AND WILDLIFE SERVICE, DEPARTMENT OF COMMERCE, US COAST GUARD (USCG), STATE OF HAWAII, TERRITORIES OF AMERICAN SAMOA, GUAM AND CNMI, AND THE STATE OF CALIFORNIA AND LOCAL AGENCIES) IN PROTECTION OF HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT IN THE EVENTUALITY OF AN OIL OR HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE ASSESSMENT AND/OR INCIDENT RESPONSE ASSOCIATED WITH A MARINE DEBRIS INCIDENT ON OR NEAR SHORE.

Product or Service Description: MAINT/REPAIR/REBUILD OF EQUIPMENT- INSTRUMENTS AND LABORATORY EQUIPMENT
Description of Requirement:
IGF::OT::IGF
THESE INSTRUMENTS ARE A TOP PRIORITY FOR REGION 5 CRL BECAUSE THEY SUPPORT COLLABORATIVE RESEARCH PROJECTS WITHIN REGION 5, WITH COLLEAGUES AT ORD AND REGIONAL AND PROGRAM OFFICES. IT IS IMPERATIVE THAT THE INSTRUMENT BE MAINTAINED WITH ITS ORIGINAL SENSITIVITY AND SPECIFICITY TO MEET QUALITY ASSURANCE OBJECTIVES FOR THESE PROJECTS. MOREOVER, GIVEN THE LARGE NUMBER OF SAMPLES ASSIGNED TO THESE INSTRUMENTS, IT IS VERY IMPORTANT THAT THEY BE OPERATED WITH MINIMAL DOWN TIME. THIS SERVICE CONTRACT WILL ASSURE THAT THIS SYSTEM WILL BE OPERATIONAL WITH MAXIMUM SENSITIVITY AND THAT SERVICE AND REPLACEMENT PARTS WILL BE IMMEDIATELY AVAILABLE SHOULD THEY BE REQUIRED.
WATERS CORPORATION IS BEST POSITIONED TO PROVIDE THIS SERVICE AS THEY ARE THE ONLY COMPANY HAVING BOTH THE PARTS AND EXPERIENCE AVAILABLE TO MEET THIS NEED IN A RAPID MANNER. THE WATERS SERVICE PROGRAM IS THE MOST SUITABLE AND EFFICIENT WAY OF QUICKLY RESOLVING AND OPTIMIZING THE INSTRUMENT PERFORMANCE. MOREOVER, AS THE COMPANY THAT DESIGNED AND BUILT THESE INSTRUMENTS, WATERS CORPORATION WILL GUARANTEE ACCESS TO AUTHORIZED FACTORY PARTS, HAVE A UNIQUE ABILITY TO DIAGNOSE AND FIX KNOWN OR RECURRENT PROBLEMS, OFFER AND RECOMMEND ENGINEERING UPGRADES, AND PROVIDE VALUABLE ADVICE CONCERNING OPERATIONAL PARAMETERS AND INSTRUMENT SETTINGS.
TO INSURE THAT ANY OTHER SERVICE VENDOR CAN PROVIDE THE SAME QUALITY OF SERVICE, THEY SHOULD MEET, AT A MINIMUM, THE FOLLOWING SPECIFIC ELEMENTS PROVIDED BY WATERS CORPORATION:
GUARANTEED PRIORITY RESPONSE- TELEPHONE SUPPORT FROM A SERVICE ENGINEER DURING NORMAL BUSINESS HOURS.  IF NOT REPAIRED BY PHONE SUPPORT, AN ON-SITE ENGINEER WILL BE SCHEDULED WITH PRIORITY RESPONSE.  
FACTORY-TRAINED AND CERTIFIED ENGINEERS- WATERS SERVICE ENGINEERS RECEIVE CONTINUOUS FACTORY TRAINING AND CERTIFICATION.
LABOR&TRAVEL FEES INCLUDED- ALL LABOR AND TRAVEL FEES ARE INCLUDED FOR REPAIR AND PLANNED MAINTENANCE.
ONE SCHEDULED PLANNED PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE VISIT PER LC/MS/MS INSTRUMENT TO ENSURE OPTIMAL PERFORMANCE OF THE INSTRUMENTS.
COVERED REPLACEMENT PARTS ALL PARTS ARE CERTIFIED AND GUARANTEED TO OPTIMIZE INSTRUMENTS PERFORMANCE AND RELIABILITY. ALL PARTS ARE MANUFACTURED BY WATERS OR DIRECT VENDORS. WATERS USES ONLY NEW OR TRUE FACTORY REMANUFACTURED PARTS.
PRIORITY TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE CENTER SUPPORT- IMMEDIATE TELEPHONE AND EMAIL ACCESS TO OUR SENIOR FACTORY-TRAINED ENGINEER INSTRUMENT TECHNICAL SUPPORT.
PRIORITY APPLICATION TECHNICAL PHONE SUPPORT- IMMEDIATE TELEPHONE ACCESS TO OUR APPLICATION TECHNICAL SUPPORT.
MONITORING REMOTE ACCESS CAPABILITY FOR COLLABORATIVE TROUBLESHOOTING, DIAGNOSTICS AND PROBLEM SOLVING WITH REAL-TIME ERROR REPORTING NOTIFICATIONS. 
FORMAL ESCALATION PROCEDURE/PROCESS WATERS GLOBAL SERVICE ENGINEERS AND MANAGERS WORK PROACTIVELY TO ADDRESS ALL INSTRUMENT ISSUES IN ACCORDANCE WITH OUR ESCALATION GUIDELINES.
SERVICE DIAGNOSTICS - SERVICE ENGINEERS HAVE FULL AND EXCLUSIVE ACCESS TO INSTRUMENT DIAGNOSTICS SOFTWARE.
CURRENT ON THE LATEST TECHNOLOGY AND TECHNIQUES - WATERS SERVICE ENGINEERS HAVE FULL AND EXCLUSIVE ACCESS TO THE LATEST TECHNICAL DEVELOPMENTS, REPAIR PROCEDURES, APPLICATION UPDATES, AND PLANNED MAINTENANCE PROCEDURES.
COMPLETE SOFTWARE AND FIRMWARE UPDATES INCLUDED TO MAINTAIN SYSTEM PERFORMANCE AND LIMIT DOWNTIME.

FACILITIES SUPPORT SERVICES (SEE ITEM 2 ENTITLED "CONTRACT LINE ITEMS NUMBERS" IN ATTACHMENT A - ADDENDA TO FAR 52.212-4, CONTRACT TERMS AND CONDITIONS-COMMERCIAL ITEMS)

THE PURPOSE OF THIS BI-LATERAL MODIFICATION IS TO INCREASE THE CEILING FOR THE BASE PERIOD FROM $257,718.84 TO $297,718.84, WHICH WILL SUPPORT ADDITIONAL WORK REQUIRED UNDER TASK 3 - MEETING SUPPORT, AND TASK 6 - DEVELOPMENT AND SUPPORT OF ALUMNICORPS. A DETAILED DESCRIPTION OF THE ADDITIONAL SERVICES REQUIRED IS PROVIDED BELOW:

- TASK 3 - MEETING SUPPORT

THE CONTRACTOR SHALL HELP THE COR AS NEEDED TO DEVELOP MATERIALS FOR UP TO FOUR (4) BRIEFINGS THROUGH THE LENGTH OF THE PROGRAM, AND A LESSONS-LEARNED MEETING AFTER THE PROGRAM IS COMPLETE. THE MEETING SUPPORT MATERIALS REQUESTED COULD INCLUDE A COMPILATION OF PROGRESS REPORTS, TECHNICAL ISSUES NEEDING RESOLUTION, AS WELL AS TRAVEL LOGISTICS FOR VISITING PARTICIPANTS.  ADDITIONALLY, THE CONTRACTOR SHALL COORDINATE ANY TRAVEL LOGISTICS FOR THE ORIENTATION AND END OF YEAR MEETINGS.

- TASK 6 - DEVELOPMENT AND SUPPORT OF ALUMNICORPS

THE CONTRACTOR SHALL ASSIST IN THE DEVELOPMENT AND ORGANIZATION OF A TRIBAL ECOAMBASSADOR ALUMNICORPS. THIS GROUP WILL ENSURE CONTINUED PROGRAM SUCCESS AND PRODUCTIVITY, WHILE ALSO ENSURING THAT THE SUCCESS PARTICIPANTS HAVE ACHIEVED REMAINS VIABLE TO THE LARGEST AUDIENCE POSSIBLE.  THE ALUMNICORPS SHALL CONSIST OF FORMER AND CURRENT PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS. THE CONTRACTOR SHALL ASSIST TO ENSURE THAT FORMER AMBASSADORS STAY CONNECTED WITH CURRENT AMBASSADORS IN ORDER TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND IN-KIND SERVICES WHEN NEEDED. THIS SUPPORT SHALL CONSIST OF THREE SEPARATE EVENTS TO INCLUDE: 

1)  ORIENTATION AT EPA HEADQUARTERS IN FALL 2014 
THIS ORIENTATION SHALL HELP TO ENSURE THAT THE PROGRAM CONTINUES TO PERFORM AND EXPAND BY FACILITATING KNOWLEDGE-SHARING BETWEEN FORMER AND CURRENT AMBASSADORS, SHARING INFORMATION ABOUT EPA RESEARCH RESOURCES AVAILABLE TO TCUS, AND A PROVIDING A FORUM FOR OPEN AND GOAL-ORIENTED DISCUSSION BETWEEN TCU PROFESSORS AND EPA SCIENTISTS ON IMPORTANT ISSUES LIKE CLIMATE CHANGE AND TRADITIONAL ECOLOGICAL KNOWLEDGE.



2)  END OF YEAR MEETING IN SUMMER 2015
THIS END-OF-YEAR MEETING WILL INCLUDE A REPORT OUT FROM EACH OF THE CURRENT AMBASSADORS TO EPA MANAGEMENT INCLUDING TOP AGENCY SCIENTISTS, AS WELL AS TO TOP AGENCY TRIBAL PROGRAM MANGERS. THERE WILL ALSO BE A LESSONS LEARNED SESSION, A DISCUSSION ON TRIBAL SCIENCE IN THE AGENCY, AND A SESSION FOR HOW TO BEST STRENGTHEN THE TCU/EPA PARTNERSHIP. (WE RE ORDERING 2 MORE OF THESE)

ORIENTATION AT EPA HEADQUARTERS IN FALL 2015 

PROVIDED THAT FUNDING IS STILL AVAILABLE, THIS ORIENTATION SHALL HELP TO ENSURE THAT THE PROGRAM CONTINUES TO PERFORM AND EXPAND BY FACILITATING KNOWLEDGE-SHARING BETWEEN FORMER AND CURRENT AMBASSADORS, SHARING INFORMATION ABOUT EPA RESEARCH RESOURCES AVAILABLE TO TCUS, AND A PROVIDING A FORUM FOR OPEN AND GOAL-ORIENTED DISCUSSION BETWEEN TCU PROFESSORS AND EPA SCIENTISTS ON IMPORTANT ISSUES LIKE CLIMATE CHANGE AND TRADITIONAL ECOLOGICAL KNOWLEDGE.
